mechanoreception.notes: As benthic marine worms, they likely possess mechanoreceptors for sensing their environment and potentially detecting water currents or substrate vibrations. This is inferred as a basic necessity for interacting with their habitat. They are filter feeders, so they must be able to sense particles in the water.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely used for food detection and possibly intraspecific communication. Being filter feeders, they must be able to detect chemical cues related to food sources.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreceptors is currently unknown. Benthic existence may or may not favor the development of photoreceptors.
